message_history.content:
A conversation between User and Assistant. The user asks a question, and the Assistant answers it. The Assistant analyzes the given question and information in the mind, retains important relevant information, calls a search engine to find necessary information, accesses web pages with certain urls, and provides the user with the answer. The Assistant conducts search by <search> query </search>, access certain url by <access> url </access>, and the top search results and url page will be returned between <information> and </information>.  The reasoning processes are enclosed within <think> </think>. Finally, the Assistant provides answer inside <answer> and </answer>, i.e. <answer> answer here </answer>. If there are multiple queries, ensure all answers are enclosed within <answer> </answer>, seperated with comma. 

Note: the question is a valid question and you should try to find a correct answer. 

User: Need to analyze the trend of the U.S. federal government spending and deficit before and after the pandemic. Please provide me with the following data through fiscal years 2015-2024: the federal Budget (trillion), the federal spending (trillion), the federal deficit (trillion), the national debt (trillion), and the net interest cost on the gross federal debt (trillion).

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following column names in order: 
Fiscal Year, Federal Budget, Federal Spending, Federal Deficit, National Debt, Net Interest Cost.
 
Under the Fiscal Year, state the statistics like FY2015, FY2016.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```

Assistant: 
<think>

To find the required data for the U.S. federal government spending and deficit from fiscal years 2015 to 2024, I'll search through reliable sources. </think>
<search> us federal budget trillion 2015-2024 </search>

Search query: us federal budget trillion 2015-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/):
Federal Spending | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the federal spending of $1.25 trillion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Nov 2024) our federal spending has decreased by $55 billion.

[Doc 2](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/61181):
The Federal Budget in Fiscal Year 2024: An Infographic The federal deficit in 2024 was $1.8 trillion, equal to 6.4 percent of gross domestic product.

[Doc 3](https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-budget/where-do-our-federal-tax-dollars-go):
Where Do Our Federal Tax Dollars Go? In fiscal year 2024, the federal government spent $6.9 trillion, amounting to 24 percent of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP), ...

[Doc 4](https://www.pgpf.org/federal-budget-guide/):
Understanding the Federal Budget | Peterson Foundation In 2024, total federal spending was $6.8 trillion — nearly 25 percent of the size of our economy and $20,100 for each person living in the United States.

[Doc 5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_federal_budget):
United States federal budget - Wikipedia CBO projects a federal budget deficit of $1.6 trillion for 2024. In the agency's projections, deficits generally increase over the coming years; the shortfall ...

I need to gather specific data for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2024 for federal budget, spending, deficit, national debt, and net interest cost on the gross federal debt. I'll search for a comprehensive source that provides this information.

</think>
<search> federal deficit by year 2015-2024 </search>

Search query: federal deficit by year 2015-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the national deficit of $711 billion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Dec 2024), our national deficit has decreased by $109 billion.

[Doc 2](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/report/deficit-tracker/):
Deficit Tracker The federal government ran a deficit of $1.8 trillion in fiscal year 2025, $41 billion (-2%) less than in fiscal year 2024. Revenues increased by $317 billion ( ...

as Percent of Gross Domestic Product (FYFSGDA188S) | FRED Graph and download economic data for Federal Surplus or Deficit [-] as Percent of Gross Domestic Product (FYFSGDA188S) from 1929 to 2024 about budget, ...

Federal Budget Receipts and Outlays Deficit, Receipts, Outlays, Surplus or. Deficit. in billions of ... Prior to fiscal year 1977 the Federal fiscal years began on July 1 and ended on June 30.
